documentContentReferences.name: Section 1.3 Self-Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Self-reference for prescreening visit tolerance details

commentAnnotations.text: Participants are required to fast before Visits 1-12. See Section 5.3.1. If a participant arrives not fasted, schedule the laboratory draw for another date.
The ICF must be signed before any protocol-specific tests or procedures are performed.
Inclusion and exclusion criteria should be confirmed prior to drug assignment and administration of first dose of study intervention.
High risk for cardiovascular events will be defined as CAD, stroke, or peripheral artery disease, or ASCVD risk equivalents (familial hypercholesterolemia or type 2 diabetes)
Includes year of birth, sex, ethnicity (where permissible), and race.
All conditions ongoing and relevant past surgical and medical history should be collected.
Any events that occur after signing the informed consent are considered AEs as defined (Appendix 10.3). Additional data are collected for certain AEs.
Participant should remove shoes.
Includes pulse rate and blood pressure measured after participant has been sitting at least 5 minutes and before ECG tracing and collection of blood samples for laboratory testing.
The physical examination is performed (excludes pelvic, rectal, and breast examinations unless clinically indicated).
Symptom-directed physical assessment will be conducted at the discretion of the PI or qualified personnel, per local regulations, as indicated based on participant status and standard of care.

Collect single, local ECG prior to collection of blood samples for laboratory testing, including PK samples. Participants should be supine for approximately 5 to 10 minutes before ECG collections and remain supine but awake during the ECG collection. ECGs may be repeated at the PI's discretion at any visit.
Females only.
Optional; performed as needed to confirm postmenopausal status.
If HCV antibody test is positive, it must be followed by an HCV RNA test.
If HBsAg is negative and HBcAb is positive, further testing with HBV DNA is required. If the screening HBV DNA is negative, the participant is not excluded.
Calculated using CKD-EPI method.
Visit 2: Collect 2 samples. 0.5 hours postdose, 4-9 hours postdose (minimum 2 hours). Visit 7: Collect 1 sample. 24-36 hours postdose, will require participant to return 1 day after Visit 7.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Schedule of Activities - Postdose PK Sample

commentAnnotations.text: Visit 2 and 7 will be collected predose.
Collect a time-matched PK sample for all scheduled and unscheduled immunogenicity samples. Visit 7 will be collected predose.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Schedule of Activities - PK Sample for Immunogenicity

commentAnnotations.text: On dosing days, collect samples before dosing
Sample can be obtained at or after the specified visit.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Schedule of Activities - Optional Genetics Sample

commentAnnotations.text: Unscheduled visits are not required to be registered in IWRS.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Schedule of Activities - Register Visit with IWRS

commentAnnotations.text: P indicates predose collection
